full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 751 Filed 08/10/22 Page 137 of 261 1298
LC6VMAX4 Kate - cross
1 have nightmares about them.
2 MS. STERNHEIM: Objection.
3 THE COURT: All right. Sustained.
4 Next question.
5 MS. POMERANTZ: Thank you, your Honor.
6 Q. You were asked some questions on cross-examination about
7 the awards you received from the Epstein Victim Compensation
8 Fund. Do you remember that?
9 A. Yes
10 Q. Can you tell the jury what the money meant to you.
11 A. Yes. What the money meant to me was recognition of my pain; what it meant to me was that my truth was important --
12 MS. STERNHEIM: Objection.
13 THE COURT: Overruled. You may answer.
14 A. It meant that I could continue to try to recover and to
15 continue to try and help other people recover from these kinds
16 of events.
17 Q. Kate, do you have any financial stake in the outcome of
18 this trial?
19 A. I do not.
20 MS. POMERANTZ: No further questions, your Honor.
21 MS. STERNHEIM: Briefly.
22 THE COURT: Yes.
23 RECROSS EXAMINATION
24 BY MS. STERNHEIM:
25 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00012888
